intro: Mitellopsis drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and its capsule-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Mitellopsis drummondii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
